abstract: Janet Maslin reviews books Pauline Kael: A Life in the Dark by Brian Kellow and Lucking Out: My Life Getting Down and Semi-Dirty in Seventies New York by James Wolcott.
snippet: Two new books, Brian Kellow’s “Pauline Kael,” and a memoir by James Wolcott, “Lucking Out,” focus on the swashbuckling era of criticism when Kael’s voice boomed.
lead_paragraph: Two new books, Brian Kellow’s “Pauline Kael,” and a memoir by James Wolcott, “Lucking Out,” focus on the swashbuckling era of criticism when Kael’s voice boomed.

headline.main: The ’70s, as Dramatic as a Movie
headline.print_headline: The ’70s, As Dramatic As a Movie
headline.seo: ‘Pauline Kael: A Life in the Dark’ and ‘Lucking Out’ - Review
